verses.roman:
sarvāśraya, sarvādbhuta, aiśvarya apāra
'ananta' kahite nāre mahimā yāṅhāra

synonyms: sarva-āśraya—the shelter of everything; sarva-adbhuta—wonderful in every respect; aiśvarya—opulences; apāra—unfathomed; ananta—Ananta Śeṣa; kahite nāre—cannot speak; mahimā yāṅhāra—the glories of whom.
translation: He [Saṅkarṣaṇa] is the shelter of everything. He is wonderful in every respect, and His opulences are infinite. Even Ananta cannot describe His glory.
